result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Offer deadline with DA is set for 10-21-22 at 8:30 a.m.    
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-15-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-08-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $150.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with A.A.A., DOB: 02-10-2001, or the residence of 1309 S. 12th Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Court will allow a one-time contact with the residence, with the aid of law enforcement, after the 72 hour no contact provision has expired, to obtain personal belongings.    Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on PO hold.  Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
